page.title: 13 PIGEON-RACING
page.content: My dad's hobby is pigeon-racing. He is in the Pheasey Club and at the end of the season, if your pigeons have won the most races you get a big cup. My dad has fifty-five pigeons. They race from Weymouth, Bath and many other places. You have special clocks to time the birds. When the first pigeon comes back you "clock it in" and enter the time on a racing sheet. You have to wait and see who has won because there are a lot of people racing pigeons. The birds have solid rings on their legs which tell you what year they were born and which club they belong to. They also have rubber rings which tell you where they have flown from. My dad sends six birds at time out racing. He sends the young ones out to gain experience while resting the older birds.
